title: Proposal: stop using bors/homu
body:
# The ugly

Everyone knows the problem:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12389383/23305238/1fcb17a2-fae1-11e6-8d99-66f485565a79.png)
**BOOM**.

We're having more and more jamming builds, while Travis has much more capacity to handle them.

The problem with bors:
* Builds are aggressively canceled.  
It's not a good idea, since it simply discards things it built before. There's definitely many spurious build failure like network, or OSX linker issues.  
The solution is so simple: we simply retry the one that failed.  
* Builds are only performed when the PR comes to top of the queue.  
We don't want to found our code was wrong after 3 days!  
(By the way, the workflow is frequently interrupted by merge conflicts, too)
* Too simple review flow.  
GitHub has a richer UI for this.

# Solution

Travis tests the PR with a merge. What's more, Travis has almost infinite capacity.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12389383/23305498/715c6002-fae2-11e6-8756-57cf5c0755a3.png)

`wow so simple and beautiful`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12389383/23305215/081632f4-fae1-11e6-8e03-b9d1c56d0436.png)

# Todo

* [ ] buildbot should be configured to pull the refs/pull/id/merge ref (merge simulation ref)
* [ ] buildbot should be configured to post GitHub status
* [ ] automatic merge on all status passing
